question: Question_12_(h)
statement:
Mark each statement either True or False. You do not have to justify
your answer.

If \textless{}v1,...,vm\textgreater{} are linearly independent vectors
in $\mathbb{R}^n$, they form a basis of subspace W in $\mathbb{R}^n$
sols:
\textbf{True}, for \textless{}v1,...,vm\textgreater{} to be linearly
independent, m \textless{}= n. Hence they satisfy
$k_1 v_1 + ... + k_m v_m \epsilon W$
